moves.2. Bc4 Nf6 3. d3 c6: I played c6 to set up d5. d5 right away would have resulted in a slight material disadvantage.
moves.4. Nf3 d5 5. exd5 cxd5 6. Bb5+ Bd7: Blocking with my B seemed to be the best move in my opinion. It allowed for development of some variety while leaving my Q and K in place. Also, it provided a direct threat if my opponent choose to move a different piece.
moves.7. Nc3 Bb4: I wanted to pressure his N and his B would be exchanged regardless.
moves.8. Bxd7+ Qxd7: I should have captured with my N instead.
moves.9. Nxe5 Qe6:
The N was now pinned to his K.  

Looking at the computer analysis from the previous move, the computer said my move here should have been Qc7. I like having both N's pinned for the time being.
moves.10. d4 O-O: I used the opportunity to tuck my K away into safety. Conversely, my opponents K was still in the center allowing his N's to remain pinned.
moves.11. Bd2 Nc6: Development of my N and threatening the d4 pawn.
moves.12. Nb5 Rad8: The computer says my move here was to Nxe5. However that leaves me vulnerable to a very nasty fork with 13. Nc7. Despite the computer saying this resulted in more than a 3 pawn swing. I am inclined to say I disagree.
I was ok with the positioning of my N. I did not want to move my N to d7. The computer keeps stating my opponents best move was to castle, however while this may be true. I did not see my opponent castling during the match. He appeared to be neglecting that aspect of play.
moves.17. Nxe4 dxe4 18. c3 f6: I was ok with the trade off in this situation. Additionally, I still had my eyes on his Q.
moves.19. Nc4: Wisely, my opponent did not want to exchange N's.
moves.19... Nd3+: While I did not see my opponent castling, I wanted to remove the option completely. I also had my eyes on another play to reduce my opponents material.
moves.20. Kd2: My opponent facilitated my plans. I would be able to claim the advantage and maintain from this point forward.
moves.20... Nxf2: I was set up fairly well from this point forward.
moves.21. Qe2 Nxh1 22. Rxh1 Rfe8: I did not see anything else of value that I could play. This move would provide extra firepower and enable me to launch my Q into battle.
moves.23. Nb6: Awkward move in my opinion. It really did nothing for my opponent.
moves.24. Kd3: My opponent played his K right into the heart of my maneuver.
moves.24... Rd6: I had limited options and opted to chase the N.
moves.25. Nc4: Im not sure what happened here however this sealed his fate.
